Class ProjectDetails

java.lang.Object
ProjectDetails
public class ProjectDetails extends Object
Reads and writes to files and creates lists of objects using the data.

Reading from files:
reads from files "All projects.txt" and generates a list of objects under the 'Project' class.

Writing to files:
Takes all the information stored in the list and writes all the information to "All projects.txt", "Completed projects.txt", "customerContacts.txt", "contractorContacts.txt" and the "architectContacts.txt" files.

Version:
3.0, 30/08/2022
Author:
Ifekharul Islam

  • Constructor Details

    • ProjectDetails

      public ProjectDetails(ArrayList<Person> customerList, ArrayList<Person> contractorList, ArrayList<Person> architechList)
      Constructs 3 list of 'Person' objects.

      The 3 lists are separated into the customer, contractor and the architect.

      Parameters:
      customerList - list of objects that hold the customer details.
      contractorList - list of objects that hold the contractor details.
      architechList - list of objects that hold the architect details.

    • setProjList

      public void setProjList()
      Reads data form the file "All projects.txt" and its elements to the elements in customer, contractor and architect lists and send the appropriate elements to the setObject() method.
      See Also:
      • ProjectDetails#getObject()
      • ProjectDetails#setObject()

    • setObject

      public void setObject(Person customer, Person contractor, Person architech, ArrayList<String> data)
      Receives data from the file; creates a 'Project' object and add the object to a list.

      Only creates a new object if the data in "All Projects.txt" matches with data in all the "Contacts.txt" files.
      If the project in the file is finalised then we set the completion state to true and set the completion date.

      Parameters:
      customer - an object under 'Person'
      contractor - an object under 'Person'
      architech - an object under 'Person'
      data - List containing string data from a file.
      See Also:
      • Person
      • Project
      • Project.setDateCompleted(Date)
      • Project.setFinalised(boolean)
      • formatDate(String)
      • castInt(String)

    • getObject

      public Person getObject(ArrayList<Person> objList, String name)
      Takes a list of Person objects and compares each elements name to a sent string. Returns the object that matches the string.
      Parameters:
      objList - List of 'Person' objects.
      name - string to compare.
      Returns:
      object that matches the string value of 'name' or null in not matched.
      See Also:

    • writeProjFile

      public void writeProjFile()
      Each objects data is written to the file "All projects.txt".
      See Also:
      • Project
      • Project.fileFormat()

    • writeCompProjFile

      public void writeCompProjFile()
      Each finalised objects data is written to the file "Completed projects.txt".

      We check each object in the projects list and only write the ones that have their finalised value set to 'true'.
      If a projects completion date is set to 'null' we just set it to todays date.

      See Also:
      • Project
      • Project.fileFormat()
      • Project.getFinalised()
      • Project.setDateCompleted(Date)

    • writeContactFiles

      public void writeContactFiles(String fileName, ArrayList<Person> contactList)
      Here we take a file name and a list; we write all the data in the list to the appropriate file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - name of the file to write to.
      contactList - list of 'Person' objects
      See Also:
      • Person
      • Person.fileFormat()
